channel.title: Afterlife
channel.description:
What do you all believe happens after death? Do you believe you just rot in the ground? Do you believe your soul enters another body?
Discuss.

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @Chronikk_HD Chronikk_HD
item.description:
@Chronikk_HD wrote:

I believe in the reincarnation theory… but there’s still a part of me that believes in Heaven and Hell also.

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @Vix Vix
item.description:
@Vix wrote:

[quote=“Invalid Username, post:98, topic:470169”][quote author=Strucker link=topic=587562.msg4353465#msg4353465 date=1377051388]

Truly never die, you will be “existing” minus the fact that “you” do not exist anymore, your atoms will carry on, the same air you breathe was inhaled by dinosaurs, technically they are still alive, there is no afterlife, god is fake, bye
[/quote]What makes you think that?

because if you believe in a book written 3500 years ago that has no proof… still… and is dis-proven through multiple theories now-a-days idk what to tell you[/quote]

Everyone is entitled to their own beliefs, although you may see his as hard to grasp i’m sure he views yours the same way. The bottom line is we have no definite answer to this question and it all boils down to opinion alone. Some obviously don’t find comfort in the possibility that life is simply a meaningless coincidence, so why would they choose to dwell on that possibility? There are a million answers to this question and who’s to say there is only one right answer?

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @furyking50 furyking50
item.description:
@furyking50 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:8, topic:470169”]My faith’s believe:

“We believe that when a person dies the soul is taken out of the human body and presented before God. If the soul is righteous, it enjoys the bounties of God and if it is wicked, it suffers the torment of the grave. The soul waits in its grave until the Day of Judgment when it will be resurrected, be judged (which is a whole other story) and goes to Heaven or Hell.”[/quote]

What i think

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:90, topic:470169”][quote author=Chrix link=topic=587562.msg4331198#msg4331198 date=1373665117]
In my own opinion there is no afterlife, and that man created god to feel as if we are not alone as well as creating religion for a means of establishing a common law (i.e. the ten commandments). Also I think anyone who believes in such a religion was born into it as well they have ‘faith’ to keep them content rather than seeing the truth as it really is.
[/quote]

You’re bringing the topic of blind faith. In other words, does the religion/faith that has the current most followers also have the most influence purely because of the population? http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claims_to_be_the_fastest-growing_religion

Now it’s obvious and maybe even common-sense nowadays that Christianity is the religion with the most population, but then again, this also brings another topic. Christianity may actually be a branch-off religion from Islam (because Jesus was an Islamic prophet). So, if you combine all Abrahamic Religions, you actually get the biggest religion.

OP - I believe in Heaven/Hell and the day of judgement.[/quote]

In christianity Jesus is not an islamic prophet, he is the son of god. It’s hard to say it’s a branch off islam when christianity came before islam and does not accept the prophet Muhammad, nor the quran.

And yeah billions of people from different religions all worship the same god. But many still do not, for example local natives here believe in multiple deities. There is also Hinduism etc. So no matter what your belief, you are really claiming A LOT of people are wrong. That’s why its best not to get too caught up in it all.

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

Chrix:

In my own opinion there is no afterlife, and that man created god to feel as if we are not alone as well as creating religion for a means of establishing a common law (i.e. the ten commandments). Also I think anyone who believes in such a religion was born into it as well they have ‘faith’ to keep them content rather than seeing the truth as it really is.

You’re bringing the topic of blind faith. In other words, does the religion/faith that has the current most followers also have the most influence purely because of the population? http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claims_to_be_the_fastest-growing_religion

Now it’s obvious and maybe even common-sense nowadays that Christianity is the religion with the most population, but then again, this also brings another topic. Christianity may actually be a branch-off religion from Islam (because Jesus was an Islamic prophet). So, if you combine all Abrahamic Religions, you actually get the biggest religion.

OP - I believe in Heaven/Hell and the day of judgement.

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

If there’s afterlife then life would probably an illusion of your own consciousness, I’ve red theory’s about it. Pretty interesting to say the least. The only way to know for sure though is to die for yourself, or you experience paranormal events.

Come on now guys, you can’t discuss these type of things. Time travel/After life. We simply don’t know because each of us is too retarded to understand such things, we are like ants in this universe. It’s cool to imagine about it though, anything is possible when it comes to life. Therefore you can’t discuss it unless you are as close minded as bowser.

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

The Taliban are disliked by most of the Muslims. They are a terrorist organization that everyone, besides themselves, and the people they have worked with, looks down on. If you’ve actually read the Quran, you’d understand that the Muslim religion is actually opposed to this. The Taliban are just a group who perceives the writing in the book as a hidden message to violently enact this. It is the same concept as some of the crazy mothers whom viciously beat their children under “the work of the Bible”. The majority of Christians frown on that, just like the majority of Muslims frown on the Taliban. Your bigotry is unnecessary, uncalled for, and completely rude. If you have something against a certain religion, there is no need for you to bring it here.

Read full topic

item.title: Afterlife
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Everyone steals, people of any race steal, it isn’t just black people. The media uses horrible stereotypes constantly which you shouldn’t depends on because it doesn’t always tell the truth. One news paper reported on a flood where they had a picture of a white couple carrying goods, saying they found them from a flooded store. There was also another with a photo of a black person in the same situation classed as shoplifting the items. Though they had both obtained them in the same matter, the black man was put down because of stereotyping. Many people post religious things about their religion, i don’t see you doing and asking them if they have to have sexual intercourse with a child to be morally just or if they have to be tight with money to be morally just. I believe Arhem means that they must be righteous from a societal stand point, rather then a personal one.

Read full topic
